text:
Allen is a city in Lyon County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 177 people lived there.
History.
Allen was created in 1854. It was incorporated as a city in 1909.
Allen was a station on the Missouri Pacific Railroad.
Geography.
Allen is at (38.656472, -96.170511). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
Weather.
Allen has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. The Köppen Climate Classification system says that Allen has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.
People.
Allen is part of the Emporia Micropolitan Statistical Area.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 177 people, 77 households, and 46 families living in Allen.
2000 census.
The 2000 census says that there were 211 people, 83 households, and 62 families living in Allen.
Education.
Allen is part of USD 251 North Lyon County. The Northern Heights High School is in Allen. The Northern Heights High School mascot is Northern Heights Wildcats.
